reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Victoria for three nights. As others have mentioned, the location of the hotel is convenient to both the central train station, the old town (Altstadt), and is directly across the street from the tourist office. If arriving by train, take the escalators down to the basement level and follow the signs to the Altstadt. At the top of the pedestrian ramp, the hotel is immediately on your left.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel, while maintaining its beautiful period architecture outside, has been modernized inside. I requested, and received, a room that faced the courtyard to the museum at the rear of the hotel on the top floor. The very clean and tidy room was of average size and contained a small desk, flat screen TV, and mini-bar. The bathroom was small and only had a shower but was clean and well maintained. A nice amenity for the guest was a selection of different types of pillows that could be requested from the front desk. This room at the back of the hotel was very quiet.
reviews.title: Could not have been better

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast that was included with my room rate was fairly extensive and included a variety of cold cereals, fresh and dried fruits, baked goods and pastries, and a couple of hot dishes (eggs, potatoes, sausages, etc.). Coffee, a variety of teas, and fruit juices were also available.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location

reviews.text: The hotel's most redeeming quality is their wonderful staff. Everyone I had contact with, front desk personnel, restaurant personnel, and housekeeping staff were uniformly friendly and always willing to help with any questions or requests. Photos of the staff are posted in the elevator along with their names and a warm welcome.
reviews.title: A good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to my next visit. The photos already posted for this hotel are an accurate depiction of the furnishings in the room in which I stayed.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in this small pricey hotel, during 12-14 May.
reviews.title: Look for an alternative

reviews.text: We had a comfort room, very small for what we paid, it means 256 euro.
reviews.title: JUST CHILL

reviews.text: In bathroom there were no toiletries, nothing except the lowest quality liquid soap for washbasin!! Not even shower gel in the bottle!
reviews.title: Small but quiet and clean

reviews.text: Bathrobe and extra pillows were provided on request, but no slippers!
reviews.title: Wow!!!!!!!! What a hotel!

reviews.text: Some recepptionists were very helpful, other was unkind, behaving arrogantly and unfriendly (the one who received us).
reviews.title: Excellent location, breakfast but my room was small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel as it is directly opposite the railway station and we were arriving by train. The hotel is in an excellent location 5 to10 minutes walk and you are in the centre of town. The staff are very friendly and the breakfast had a good selection and was very nice with the option of eating outside which we did as the weather was really nice whilst we were there.
reviews.title: Great hotel - good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative are the rooms, they are small, we only had two nights so it was not a huge problem but I can imagine if you had a longer stay, it could become very cramped. On saying this the rooms were exceptionally clean and we had a room at the back of the hotel which was nice and quiet.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: Overall I would definately reccommed this hotel as the postives outnumbered the one negative.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in the heart of Nuremberg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately reccommend Nuremberg, we only had two nights and it was not long enough to do everything that we wanted to. But this is good excuse to go back.
reviews.title: Did not stay and already had horrible customer service

reviews.text: The hotel is located across from the main train station and yet directly in the historical city center, surrounded by the city wall and the monumental tower of the king's gate. It's a great location! The main shopping and restaurant area as well as all sightseeing highlights of the city are at walking distance.
reviews.title: if you want old-city and close to the train, its fine but the rooms are small

reviews.text: I was in Nurnberg for two days in occasion of a big concert in town. I wanted to stay the first night in the city center to visit the old town and the day after I have moved to another other closed to the concert location.
reviews.title: Great hotel -
The Perfect Hotel!
reviews.text: The Victoria was the first hotel I saw entering the city walls. The lady at the concierge has been nice to me and I have decided to take the room. The room was perfect for me.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel located perfectly
reviews.text: Beautiful, spacious and clean. The breakfast was very very good and the waiter at the breakfast was gracious and always smiling and helping people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 1 night at the Hotel Victoria and wished we could have stayed longer. This will be my go-to hotel in Nuremburg from now on. The location is excellent - just inside the city wall and literally steps from the underground passage leading to the train station. Our room was smallish, but well-laid out with plenty of storage and room to move around. The staff at the hotel is top notch and the breakfast buffet was a cut above what we usually find in German hotels at this price range.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Spent a night in the hotel. The hotel is a couple of minutes from the train station just inside the old city walls. The rooms are clean and comfortable, if a little small. The staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good. Would be very happy to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, good value.

reviews.text: Adjacent city wall, rwo minutes train station and adjacent a craft market. An old building done in a funky contemporary city centre style with bright gerbera prints and quality lighting in the restaurant. Very friend and very helpful to my familt and kids. Ask for outer facing room as out second room inward facing was a bit dark with little natural light.
reviews.title: A fun hotel with young enthusiatic staff

reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night at the Hotel Victoria in Nuremberg, Germany and had a good experience. The hotel is very conveniently located to the train station and the Old Town. The reception staff was exceptional. They were the best reception staff we encountered on our month long vacation in Europe. We stayed on the 2nd floor with our room overlooking the front of the hotel. I believe the apartment was called the Blickfang. It was very spacious and nice. However there was no A/C and we had to open a window which overlooked a bar next door so the street noise was a little loud. If I were to stay again I would request a room not facing the front of the hotel. A very nice breakfast was provided. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is literally minutes by foot from the main train station. Nuremberg is like a fairy tale city and the staff at Hotel Victoria was as friendly and helpful as anyone could be.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 days at the beginning of May and it was in an excellent location near the station. Luckily for tourists the best parts of the old town are easily accessed from the hotels near the station but the Victoria is a very short walk so it would be excellent for people who did not want to haul luggage through town. We had a room that looked out over the road/pedestrian area out front and we watched many people getting dropped off at the gate and then having to walk to find their hotels. The staff at the Victoria are very helpful and the breakfast was excellent. They do not have any internet cafes nearby so my tip for you if you are looking for internet in near here is to go to the station and then go up the escalator to your left and near the MacDonalds or Burger King (I can't remember what it was) go right and just along the walkway at the top there is a very new and clean internet/pub. Overall, I would recommend this hotel - it was clean, roomy and nearby all the main central sights.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Just had a week in the Logenplatz suite, an expensive (for me) treat to myself at the beginning of an 8 week work sabbatical in Germany.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.text: The location is fantastic, just at the end of the underpass out of the station. Plus the public transport is so good that one night, having seen the last curtain calls at the opera (which has its own doors onto the Ubahn!) at 22:40, I was back in my room by 22:50. That's efficiency! The locations is also great on Koenigstrasse for access to the sights and shops.
reviews.title: Great hotel, slightlyunusual

reviews.text: The room is huge, very long, divided into 3 distinct areas for sitting, bedding and bathrooming. The freestanding bath with the rainbow lights was good - clearly meant for romantic twosomes but I can't blame the hotel that I was there alone!
reviews.title: Excellent Access and Helpful Staff

likes.liked: — The front desk staff was excellent and extremely helpful, even allowing us to try our pitiful German without judgment.
likes.disliked: — It fronts to a busy street/pedestiran walk way with the u-bahn right outside the door. It can get noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was good but not special. The receptionists were helpful when asked but a lot more information would have been better. There was no hotel information pack in the room, so I never did receive information about breakfast times, use of the terrace cafe and so on. In fact, it was only the last day that I discovered the terrace cafe was open every day, I'd thought it was only for special events.
reviews.title: Easy Weekend

likes.liked: — Clean, close to everything in Old town, ,roomy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with all aspects of our stay at this gem of a hotel.
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With its history in the city, it has been totally remodeled inside. The rooms are comfortable, the service was excellent and with free internet it was great. It is located as you enter the old city walls...a perfect location.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Highly Recomended!!

reviews.text: Out of our 15 day European vacation and staying at about 8 hotels, this was by far the BEST hotel we stayed at in Europe.
reviews.title: nice little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first impression of the hotel was, of course, at the front desk where we were greeted by the EXTREMELY helpful staff. The hotel was VERY convenient to the train station literally across the street with access via underground pedestrian walkway (all connected to the train station). Also, this hotel was a great location for the old city section of the town.
reviews.title: A little pricey but it was the Christkindlesmarkt season

reviews.text: In terms of size we were not expecting much but it was about average size (typical for Europe and similar to what we have stayed at in NYC & San Francisco). However, we still had enough room for our big suitcase and big pack. The room had an armouir with a safe in it. The hotel has the old charm accompanied by modern furnishings, beds, and bath.
reviews.title: Superb value for money
